ComponentCalibrator
public class ComponentCalibratorBracketing
extends java.lang.Object
implements ComponentCalibrator

Calibrates the component using the bracketing method

Constructor Detail

ComponentCalibratorBracketing

public ComponentCalibratorBracketing()
Constructs an empty ComponentCalibratorBracketing

ComponentCalibratorBracketing

public ComponentCalibratorBracketing(int iBracketMethod,
                                     int iMaxIterations,
                                     double dblCalibFloor,
                                     double dblCalibCeiling,
                                     double dblRelTolerance)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
Constructs a ComponentCalibratorBracketing instance from the bracketing parameters

Parameters:
iBracketMethod - One of BRACKET_SECANT, BRACKET_BISECTION, BRACKET_COMPOSITE
iMaxIterations - Maximum number of iterations
dblCalibFloor - Floor below which the calibration is deemed to have failed
dblCalibCeiling - Ceiling above which the calibration is deemed to have failed
dblRelTolerance - The Relative tolerance to determine the vicinity of the error
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the component cannot be calibrated

Bootstraps the hazard rate curve from the component quote

Specified by:
bootstrapHazardRate in interface ComponentCalibrator
Parameters:
cc - Credit Curve
comp - Calibration Component
iInstr - Bootstrap index
valParams - ValuationParams
dc - Base Discount Curve

dcEDSF - EDSF Discount Curve
pricerParamsIn - PricerParams
strMeasure - Component measure to be calibrated
dblCalibValue - Component measure quote
mmFixings - Fixings object
quotingParams - Quoting Parameters
bFlat - Flat calibration (true), True bootstrapping (false)
Returns:
Success (true), failure (false)
